Following are the characteristics of chemical equilibrium.

column1: Equilibrium can be achieved from either from reactant or from product side.
Equilibrium is achieved when there is no net change in the concentrations of reactants and products.
Presence of catalyst does not affect the position of equilibria, i.e., value of equilibrium constant.
Catalyst only helps in increasing the rate of reaction to achieve equilibrium quickly.
Option 3 is incorrect statement because at equilibrium, the concentration of reactants and products is not necessary to be equal.

There are two types of cells. One is primary and the other one is secondary cell.
The secondary cell is one which is rechargable. Since the redox reaction of the secondary cell is reversible, i.e., it can be recharged by passing current in opposite direction.
The secondary cell can be recharged by passing current in opposite direction by using voltage greater than the emf of the cell.

Chlorine has the highest negative electron gain enthalpy, so gaseous Cl atoms have a maximum tendency to accept electrons and therefore chlorine is expected to be the strongest oxidizing agent.

column1: However chlorine is not the strongest oxidizing agent, but fluorine is the strongest oxidizing agent because F2 has a low enthalpy of dissociation due to a weak F-F bond which results due to repulsion between the non-bonding electrons in the small molecule of F2.
It is also the strongest oxidizing agent because of the high free energy of hydration, which is seen due to the smaller size of F- ion formed.

column2: anomalous behavior of Fluorine is attributed to its small size, higher electronegativity, low bond dissociation enthalpy, and absence of vacant d-orbitals in its valence shell.
